intro: Scorzonella pratensis, commonly known as meadow scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, moist grasslands and meadows, often in temperate climates. It has slender, branched stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers appear in late spring to early summer, contributing to its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
